reviews.review_text: Unbelievable food (every single dish we had was fantastic), amazing service, very cool atmosphere. The staff is amazing and welcoming. We had a great time with our servers Melissa and Heidi! They brought the 10/10 experience to 100/10. Would highly recommend. Also, its best to make a reservation.

I used to live at this place but that was another lifetime. Went with the family this visit. Crab cake was fantastic. Large enough for 2 to split, nice big pieces of crab. Stoli martinis were expertly made (hard to mess that up, but it s happened), very cold .this place can do no wrong. The people next to us had the fish &chips, looked fantastic. We also ordered the burger (very good) and a salad of some kind (can t recall). If you visit Vancouver this place is one of my  must-see locations .

The service was exceptional as we enjoyed the patio at sunset. The sun was directly in our eyes, but the attentive waiter brought an extra umbrella to shield us from the glare. Our party of six ordered appetizers, steaks, and drinks, and everything was excellent. This restaurant stands out as the first place that prepared my steak exactly as I wanted it   medium rare, cooked to perfection. One of my friends ordered theirs rare and it ended up slightly overcooked, but they still found it enjoyable and were satisfied with their meal.

Stopped in for Happy Hour (3pm-5pm daily) and the food, service, and vibe were all spot on! First, our server was Norm and he was great! Personable and funny and checked in the perfect amount of times. Hes the type of server that elevates your dining experience. I applaud the entire staff as their communication was great and they all worked together to handle a packed house very efficiently. Now onto the food. We did the Crispy Calamari, Truffle Parmesan Fries, Miso Glazed Short Ribs, and Joes Chilled Seafood Platter. We closed it out with the Creme Brulee. The calamari was the best Ive ever had. We ended out grabbing a 2nd order of those. Fries were tasty. The short ribs were so-so. Our favorites on the seafood platter were the scallop ceviche and the albacore tuna crudo. The prawns were some big boys as well. All of the seafood tasted fresh and the platter had great plating. The creme brulee was presented well and took a couple of hits to crack through the top which is expected. Amazing! Overall, the food quality, price point, and service puts this place at 5 stars for me.

My bf and I had a great time here! Happy our menu is a bless!!! Oysters were so fresh, calamari was so good too!!! Highly recommend for the happy hour menu! Staff was very friendly and helpful~ we will go back again next time in town!

Came here on a Monday evening on a rainy day in November, and the restaurant was pretty busy. The ambience was great, there was live pianist that give a classy touch to the restaurant. The dipping Lobster oil and vinager for the bread,  the Tomato bisque, the Salmon Wellington, and the Tiramisu, where simply delicious I was served by Vincent and his assistant Guillermo, both and other members of the staff were very friendly, courteous and attentive to details.

My friend and I went for happy hour and had the mini lobster/shrimp rolls, calamari, and truffle parmesan fries, we also had the shrimp cocktail. The bar had a great non-alcoholic drink, so yummy. The atmosphere was fun. The food was great. I would skip the shrimp cocktail, two medium-sized shrimp for $14, and was a bit of a rip-off. But the calamari was the best I ever had.
Went for the early happy hour special, which was great value. Staff were friendly, and service was great. Had the lobster roll, truffle pamesab fries, and seafood platter and it was all delicious

Had gone for a quiet dinner as it was highly recommended by Tom Ford Store owner. One feels good when as a tourist good eating joints are recommended by the locals. Michael our server was so sweet, kind & helpful to suggest the best of the dish & wine. We ended up talking long as we were the last of the customers to leave. Sea food platter was awesome & we had a great time. Tiramisu.. TOP NOTCH.. thanks Michael
We just went for the happy hour. Appetizers  were very good. Drinks were so so. Prices for dinner were reasonable but did not gave the chance to make it for dinner. Food

By far the best Happy Hour Menu in Downtown! I would recommend going here if you are in the area. The seafood tower for the price is enough for 2 people. The beef carpaccio was so good! Service was quick, and our server was nice. I highly suggest you book ahead if you want to try their Happy Hour without waiting in line.

Was seated at the bar and had an awesome time. Service was impeccable. As for the food?Disappointed as I wanted to try 2 of each of their 8 oyster options  but they only had 3 options. At that point, they should have ask about our oyster of the day.  Underwhelming to be told 5 of the 8 items you want arent available. Especially because this is supposed to be a fine dining restaurant.

Very nice interior and vibes, if you want to take some photo, sit inside. If you just want to chill, try rooftop. I also like what the servers wear. Food is excellent, service is good. Seafood platter is top notch. Really enjoyed the dining experience here!

A fancy restaurant with fresh seafood and excellent service! It s my first time to try oysters and the staff gave me great suggestions. Seafood is fresh and delicious, and lively vibe with piano music. It s located in the heart of downtown, won t be regret to come back!

Had a great time visiting this spot ! Service is out of this world. We had multiple people serving our table during our meal. As for the food. Absolutely delicious. We tried two different seafood platters and enjoyed every bite. Highly recommend the oysters. We will be coming back.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Joe Fotes seafood restaurant, and it was truly an incredible experience from start to finish. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warm and friendly service that set the tone for the entire evening. The ambiance of the restaurant was perfect for a seafood lover like myself. The nautical decor & soft lighting created a relaxing and inviting atmosphere. Now, lets talk about the star of the show   the food. Joe Fotes seafood restaurant exceeded all of my expectations. The menu was a seafood lovers dream come true, with a wide variety of fresh catches from the sea. I started with my favorite: fish & chips. However, the portion size was huge. We ended with seable fish and paired it with a nice bottle of champagne. We finished with Creme brulee and chocolate cake. Highly recommend this restaurant.

Top quality of the Oysters! Delicious and super fresh Miso Glazed Sablefish - Must try dish! Lobster Oil & Vinegar to dip your dinner baguette! Server was very professional, informative, and super friendly. I cant wait for my next visit!

Celebrated a birthday with       service. The hostess team was kind enough to personalize my menu as a souvenir. A+ for atmosphere; Fortes does an amazing job of making a huge restaurant still feel cozy (and their plants are real and so well cared for)! Definitely adding it to my  safety list  for perfect service and a menu that will accommodate me what kind of vegetarian chooses a seafood chophouse ?!

We went here last night because Joe s was recommended a lot on a social platform. Wade (if I didn t remember his name wrong) was the one served me and my husband, he was really professional, nice and funny. He recommended us taking Cajun crab & corn from happy hour menu as it might be too much for 2 of us taking 4 dishes. Food is delicious and I would really recommend all these 4 and halibut cheeks as seasonal option. Thanks again Wade, you really made us the day!

We went without reservations and they were kind enough to accommodate us at the patio. Maybe because it was a weekday, but all the same we were lucky. The staff were very friendly, special thanks to Mahdieh (I hope I spelled it right) she was very kind. She even gifted us a desert treat to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We ordered the seafood tower. Amazing! Everything fresh. The lobster oil  was unbelievable. It definitely made our occasion memorable.

Service was friendly and the waiters were accommodating. There was something for everyone, including hot chocolate. Great flavour and nice portions. Happy hour wine couldnt be beat at $1 an ounce... I definitely recommend Joe Fortes for lunch, happy hour and dinner.

Happy Hour here makes me so happy! The best oysters for such a great price! Also obsessed with the shrimp and lobster roll! We ve had a la crate dinner here for an after wedding celebration and everything was to perfection. Waiters are so friendly too
All the food was delicious, but what particularly impressed us was the Miso Sablefish. The complimentary dessert truly amazed us, and the service was top-notch.

Ive been here before but today was the perfect experience thanks to our lovely server Anais. She was so kind and thoughtful! I really wanted the sable fish which is usually only available for dinner, but Anais pulled some strings in the kitchen and I was able to have it for lunch today :) Its one of my fave dishes here as the fish is so buttery and the miso glaze is nice and sweet. My friend had the halibut which she loved. We also shared the deep fried oysters which were delicious. Our coffees were constantly refilled for us (thank you) and Anais brought us the tastiest dessert which happened to also be one of my faves... The creme brulee! The rooftop patio is one of the prettiest in the city and even though today was partly cloudy, we were very comfortable sitting up there. Joe Fortes is a restaurant I always recommend to my friends. Not only is the food and service consistently great but the restaurant always donates a gift card to our hospital unit every Christmas :) HealthCare workers absolutely love Joe Fortes! Thank you!

Brunch was excellent.  The seafood platter was such a treat. The piano was a bit hard to speak over, so it would be good to request a quiet seat. Service was excellent and they the meals as requested because we wanted it all.

We had an amazing dinner here tonight! We made a reservation and were seated on arrival. We will thrilled our request for a booth was honoured. The wine list was diverse and we found a great pairing with our mains. The appetizers were delicious and well prepared. The specials were great, service impeccable throughout by the whole team. All in a dining room with piano music yet intimate with real candles and more dimly lit fixture expected in a fine restaurant. We definitely look forward to our next visit.

I recommend sablefish! I actually saw others who mentioned it and tried it here the first time! Loved it~ the fried oysters are worth trying! The fish and chip is also great. I would come again next time around~

Matt the manager is a Rock Star!!!  Not only did he get us a fabulous table to celebrate my Mom s birthday. He provided excellent customer service and made our birthday celebration so wonderful. Boyd our server was super Awesome also. He recommended great dishes and the food was so Fabulous!!!  Thank you so much Matt & Boyd for making our birthday celebration so Wonderful . You both are the BEST and you go the extra mile for your customers and it s truly appreciated

The Fish and Chips and Calamari at Joe Fortes are simply outstanding. The crispy golden batter on the fish and calamari is expertly fried to perfection, resulting in a delightful crunch with each bite. The seafood itself is tender and flavorful, with the fish flaking apart beautifully. The accompanying tartar sauce adds a tangy and creamy touch that complements the dish wonderfully. Joe Fortes attention to detail and quality shines through in this classic seafood dish. If youre a fan of fish and chips and calamari, you wont be disappointed with the offerings at Joe Fortes.

Took my girlfriend here for her Bday, she had a crab, and I had jumbo scallops. The food was great, and the portions were adequate. The service was really good. They brought her a creme brule for her bday desert, and it was really good too. It was a bit noisy, which isnt a big deal for us.

Amazing food and experience. While it is definitely on the pricey side there is a great happy hour wine ($1/Oz)and appy special that we have enjoyed. The service was fantastic here, very friendly staff, and a great atmosphere. Everything we have eaten has been fantastic, a few of our favourites being the mini lobster rolls, calamari, deep fried oysters and of course fresh oysters. Highly recommended.
One of the best seafood restaurant in Vancouver. fresh and delicious,hundred percent sure that you won t be disappointed here.

Vancouver has many amazing brunch places, but I sure think Joe Fortes is one of the best few. This is why I chose this restaurant for my birthday brunch with the girls. The food was absolutely delicious (as always) & we had an amazing server who was super attentive. I wish I got his name! One of my friends had a severe garlic allergy and we quickly learned she couldn t have anything on the menu but the oysters. The waiter apologized multiple times but she is very used to that when going out to eat so she was totally unbothered by it. It came as a huge pleasant surprise to us when he brought out a complementary dish from the Chef that she could have! Thank you, Chef! What a service. Lastly thank you so much for the birthday dessert. That creme brulee was delicious! You can tell a restaurant has an amazing internal culture when everyone comes together to make your experience top notch.
We went to visit for happy hour (3pm-5pm) and tied oysters for the first time. Unfortunately we weren t fans, but we really enjoyed the overall atmosphere & service of the place.

Excellent service by Brian and his team Carrot cake was excellent so were oysters and seafood pasta. Ambulance was great as well had a fantastic evening. Thank you. For the hospitality Recommended dishes

Splurged on a  snack  with my partner in-between shopping around Robson. Their seafood platter was very fresh and the portion size was nice for sharing between two people. Definitely will be back for a full meal and to try other dishes.

First visit ..... It was a Birthday celebration.  We happened to arrive at Happy hour...  which meant it was so affordable...so we ordered a variety of dishes to sample.  Delicious!!   They were able to accommodate some Gluten free options. We ended up staying after the Happy hour and decided to share even more fantastic seafood dishes. Oysters were perfect. Excellent service. We were also thrilled to enjoy an amazing pianist on this Sunday evening.  We have already made plans to return next month.

Thank you to our server, Adam, for a smooth  n seamless, pleasant experience. On this particular visit, we were celebrating our friends. It was their first time, and they loved the evening we had together. We ve come here several times. We love the piano playing in the background. The pork chop was really good. I had the seafood linguine. The noodles and seafood were cooked well; however, the dish was quite under-seasoned. All in all, a great evening was had.

Fantastic service overall from our server Brooklyn, who was highly attentive to our group: she offered suggestions between different menu options, was quick with conveying what the restaurant was out of for that night, and had excellent serving skills. The food was delicious overall, from the shared appetizers within our group, the generously portioned main courses, and the amazing desserts. If you are planning to come for a three-course meal, arrive hungry so you dont miss out! Definitely will be returning here when next in Vancouver.

Walking into a place that keeps its character since the 60 s .. wallpaper, brass lighting fixtures.. food was wonderful though should be locally sourced in BC. Get rid of the Steelhead as it s raised in a lake and feed pellets, why serve shrimp from overseas.. this restaurant is highly sought after though create local cuisine. We re in Vancouver, the ocean is teaming with amazing seafood items that we export all over the world.

This place is simply amazing with so many delicious food options. Everything looked so good and was delicious I forgot to even take pictures. Absolutely loved the club sandwich and the onion rings are a must!

Havent been to Joe Fortes in years, was excited to visit for my besties birthday brunch and the food was even better than before! Oysters were fresh and delectable, and calamari was flavourful, crispy and  non-greasy. Chicken and waffles were incredibly delicious - must try for brunch. Our server Mya was lovely, friendly and attentive - she went above and beyond. We appreciated the complimentary birthday dessert, it was yummy! Only con, they need a better system for group bills, should be way more efficient - we waited 25 to 30 mins for the final, accurate bill per person (made us late for the mani/pedi appointment we had scheduled). Will be heading back in the summer to check out the rooftop bar.

Very attentive wait staff. Comfortable seating, live piano (upstairs). Prices are higher but value is in the quality and quantity of your meal. Beautiful bar within the dining room at which you may dine. We had a reservation for 8 ppl and our table was ready on arrival. Meals and apps were delicious! I have posted several photos for description. If you are looking for a special dining experience downtown you wont be disappointed!

Everything were so nice. Atmosphere, service and quality of the food as well. For me, I m not a big fan of oyster, but I changed my mind since I tried in here. There are different kinds of oyster, it was hard to choose between them. But our server kindly explained and I ve got her favorite and the choice was totally right. Salmon and lobster soup were amazing as well! Lastly the Cream brulee makes me satisfied.
They have the best happy hour. From the corn fritters to the French fries. All are delicious, and the service is top notch. Its a must go to when in Vancouver
Let me start by saying this was a birthday meal and they didnt disappoint. Best meal I had while in Vancouver.  The Halibut was incredible, see pic!!!

Joe Fortes had to be the best stop we had for any of our meals during our trip to BC! We went for lunch and ordered their calamari, lobster roll, Sable fish and a series of oysters. While everything we ordered was delicious, the Sable fish was probably the best prepared fish weve ever had. Top off the amazing food with stellar service from our server Norm and it was an exemplary experience from start to finish. Couple months later we also received a handwritten letter from Norm/the restaurant and it was so far above and beyond what we would expect that Joe Fortes will definitely be a spot we go to every time were in Vancouver. Highly recommended!

Such a great experience we had in this place. Awesome atmosphere, professional and nice staffs. Kids friendly place. Fresh and genuine taste. Its a must for everyone who visits Vancouver. The only issue we had is we were not satisfied with our steak doneness. Cheers!
The food was awesome, but the service was even more so! Great place to visit for any occasion.
Had great clam chowder, steak and mussels there. Lovely atmosphere on the patio, and our server Daniel was very friendly and professional.

Fantastic fantastic fantastic. Not exactly a regular pub/drinks place unless you have lots of $$ but better suited for more special occasions or business events. Food is incredible. The 16 oz steak (medium; Chicago-style sear) was perfect  over filling actually  ditto for the Chef s seafood special (market cost) with salmon, scallops, prawns and veggies. A bottle of cold Rose wine finished off this excellent meal.  We left this restaurant limping and bawling in glorious full-tummy stretched-belly-burst tight-pants pain but, you know, im referring to the wonderful over-eating glutton kind of pain (you know what I mean).  Definitely will go again for a special occasion; it is expensive ($350 all in after tax/tip for one helluva meal for two) but you get what you pay for. Service is very fast and accurate. Decor is upscale and there is a dress code at dinner (business casual; beware sneaker wearers). Just an excellent all-round chop house in downtown Vancouver.  Oof, time to lie down and unbutton everything

One of the best Sea Food restaurants in Town. Restaurant has great ambiance with great staff. Fine dining at its best as the restaurant costs on higher side but its worth the Taste and varieties they carry on menu. Overall, if you are Sea Food lover or want to experience some different food give it a try.
Fav seafoods spot in town. Their lobster oil is a must to try. Definitely need to check out their patio during the summer time.

Went for lunch on their rooftop patio on a Saturday afternoon. What an awesome location! I ve lived in the Vancouver area for 45+ years and this was the first time visiting Joe Fortes. I can t believe I waited this long. The food was perfect. The portions were a good size. The service was top notch. I can t wait to go back.

We went for happy hours, their oyster was $1.5 each. The size was small but very fresh! We also tried their seafood platter, jumbo prawn cocktail, mini lobster & shrimp rolls. Food and service were great.
This must be one of the best restaurants in Vancouver. So good we went twice. Excellent food  , service  , and atmosphere. Food : 5/5

It was first time at Joe Fortes, and It was a wonderful experience. It was a large group of us and we thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere, the food was outstanding. So much flavors, we ordered oysters which were fresh as ever. The food selection is quite nice, a little pricey but worth it for special occasions etc. The live piano playing was a nice touch, set the ambience just right. Def would like to check out the rooftop patio next time. Overall great experience, and would recommend going.

Every time we have eaten at Joe Fortes, it has been excellent. The menu have a wide variety of items and there is a daily fresh sheet as well. We have never been disappointed yet. Our favorite restaurant here in downtown Vancouver.

Great dining experience with friendly staff and great seafood! The happy hour menu is very worth it and would recommend the seafood platter. Only thing the party didnt like was the shrimp, which were slightly rubbery. The tacos were nicely spiced and the lobster rolls were buttery and decadent. Get the cheesecake for dessert! Its fluffier than a regular New York Style Cheesecake and has a hint of lemon with homemade shipped cream. I could have eaten three slices myself because it was so light.

Spectacular service during happy hour 3-5pm daily, but they were super busy at 4 on a Monday. I came here with a reservation for 2, and you get a 1.5h seating limit. They had some great deals for drinks (wine $1 per ounce which Ive never seen before) and some great food choices. The seafood platter was amazing with a ton of variety and the lobster/shrimp roll was delicious too. Service was very attentive and prompt, a great time all around.

Our party of 5 was hungry for meaty things and the Surf and Turf did not disappoint. We shared a couple of appetizers, each ordered a side dish to go with the Surf and Turf, and completed it with two desserts. It was the perfect amount of food. Highlights for me were the lobster, scallops, and creme brulee. Our server Gordon was amazing! We ll definitely be back.

Well worth the Dine Out Vancouver price of $65/pp. Service was superb and our waiter was very attentive and engaging. The complimentary bread came with lobster infused oil and balsamic vinegar as a dip, and the lobster was fragrant. The highlights were the steelhead trout (melted in our mouth, and were still raving about the vin blanc sauce) and Tahitian vanilla creme brulee (bitter, caramelized topping balanced the custard perfectly). The only downside is that its not a place to go for a quiet evening out. Theres lots of chatter and the tables are relatively close to each other, along with live piano music from an upper level. Had a great experience here in both quality and size of the dishes. Would return for a special occasion!
I had the oysters at $4.15 a piece loved the selection and ponzu sauce which was amazing will be back with my family to try some entrees have a great one btw servers very helpful

Absolutely phenomenal experience Possibly the BEST SEAFOOD Ive ever had in Vancouver + metro Vancouver area! On top of that, the service here is just so astounding, how much detail the servers pay attention to. I was so surprised to find my napkin nicely folded after coming back from bathroom, they really went above and beyond Make sure you ask for extra FREE bread for the lobster oil they serve! It was so delicious and heavenly, I wanted to drizzle it all over the rice that came with the tasting seafood platter tower thing my boyfriend and I ordered!
Beautiful warm venue, small portion but great quality seafood. Happy hour was great

First time visiting for Xmas we absolutely loved it! The atmosphere is very relaxing and fancy; it has amazing vibes with the live piano. Everyone been so friendly and the waiter made sure we like our food since we asked for few modifications on the sauce for main course and appetizers. Ordered steak and Jalapeno aioli and it was delicious! Calamari was absolutely fresh and crispy. Main course which was steak was pretty rare ( my fav). Will definitely go back whenever we need vibes.

Food was outstanding and our server was excellent. The potato pate wasnt my cup of tea and the server insisted on getting something else.  Steak was perfectly cooked and was very happy we were able to order a half dessert (smart!).  Ordered a bourbon cocktail as well and it was amazing. Will be returning here! Dietary restrictions: They were very cognizant and asked twice about any allergies.

We were at Joe Fortes in April and it never disappoints! We were at Coast originally and had the WORST service over there. We walked over to Joe Fortes and had amazing service. Not only that, we told our waitress the rough service we recieved and were gifted a desert. She bought us a desert! Amazing experience and will go back every single time we are back visiting Vancouver. We will hopefully be back around Christmas.

Went to Joe Fortes for late lunch on Wednesday afternoon, June 29, 2022.  We had a group of 10. Restaurant is spacious, clean and 2 levels including roof top patio.  The patio is fantastic on a sunny day! Service was amazing  and all our food items were delicious.  Place never disappoints. If you love seafood and great service, Joe Fortes is the place to be!

I really liked this place. Specially because I am seafood lover. Service was amazing, our server Roben made our experience very enjoyable. He was very thoughtful to my niece and got a dessert for her. (It happened to be her absolute favourite Creme Brulee) I loved the busy and yet organized vibe, perfect Saturday night plan after a hectic week at work. I had the salmon listed on the menu of the day. I was expecting a bit more flavour to it but honestly it was beso cooked and presented. The rest of the dishes were amazing. When I go back I will want to try their Seafood Cioppinno, my sister loved it and Desserts were good but nothing impressive. Wine selection is to die for. Just be ready to spend some cash! :)

Gosh how happy I am to stop by without reservations and they have table available for us! Place is Grand and big! Staffs are super friendly, coming to check on us frequently. Oysters are fresh! Especially love their mussels. Everything here from interior, ambiance, food to service are top notch! For oysters, there are several types to choose from. Im not an expert, i told the waiters of my preference for oyster, he choose of us. And they are just the way i like them. Mussels cooked in wine, now mussel is my favorite. I even drink all the sauce. Its that good! Lobster roll is perfect too. Generous amount of lobster meat mixed with mayo, salad and gherkin on the side. Last but not the least, Tiramisu. Ordered half portion, which is perfect size. It is ok. Average. Had better tiramisu. All in all, love the place!

The freshest seafood in Vancouver and something you do not want to miss. Again, please make sure to make reservations. This place is always busy and does not disappoint. Everything in the menu is great, good collection of wine and the place is gorgeous. Great for family, business events or while wanting to impress your date. Make sure to check it out, I know I enjoyed it.  Keep on eating and have fun. #chicosreviews

I have been lucky enough to come to this place a number of times in the past 9 years. The food here is nothing short of spectacular. The Ling Cod is stunning. The crab cakes are to die for. If you like seafood. This is an absolute must. The staff are wonderful, the music is fantastic, the food... words cant even describe how good the food is.

Happy Hour local oysters were so fresh and delicious! House wine was great. Rockefeller Oysters were good. Clam chowder was under seasoned. Trio fish special was heavenly fresh and Delicious. Pavlova desert was out of this world! Service is outstanding,Highly recommend!

Had a wonderful Evening at Joe Fortes. The Atmosphere was very good . There is even a Piano on the middle of the Staircase going to the upper level of the Restaurant. It was the first time my girlfriend had been there. I took her for her Birthday. The food was exceptionally good and so was the Service . I would Definitely recommend this place to Everyone.

Came here for the first time for dine out! I thoroughly enjoyed my meal, especially the appetizers. I think the salmon and tuna tartare along with the mussels were my favourite! The creme brulee and the sauce on the ravioli with the trout were also great. The steak was cooked correctly but still quite tough, but it is what it is for a dine out menu. Overall it was great and I would come back!

One of the best dining experiences of my life. Hands down! Everything was so good and the service was excellent!! The beverage I got was Rise Above, meal was Ling Cod, and dessert was key lime pie. All very, very yummy!
Shrimp Linguine and Baileys Tiramisu were good, nothing great. Mango/lemon sorbet were inedibly sweet.
Amazing food and service.  Best oysters I have tasted, juicy and tender steak, good desert. Great customer service.

My new favourite restaurant. Wow! The ambience is like an old style resraurant with wine bottles in cases from floor to ceiling and a pianist playing wonderful tunes. I think we ordered a lot for 2 people, but had enough leftovers for another meal. They served us bread with a lobster oil balsamic dip to start. I have never had lobster oil dipped bread and it was amazing! We got the oysters rockefeller, clam chowder, and steak tartare to start. Oysters were pretty big size and delicious. Clam chowder was clammy with a hint of bacon. Steak tartare is my favourite dish and it did not disappoint. For mains, we ordered the shortrib with risotto and kale, and the seafood ciopinno. Shortrib was by far the best thing Ive had. Oh, we also got the brussel sprouts on the side, which were fried up and salty. For dessert, we ordered the half size creme brulee, which was still a massive portion! We also ordered the chocolate cake, which was also huge, for takeout as our server highly recommended it. I will definitely be back at Joe Fortes next time Im in Vancouver!

We went today for happy hour and we really loved it. The service was great and food very delicious. I was surprised that we didn t have to wait for a table they received us very quickly. Thank you for the prompt service to the hostesses. Food was fresh and came in in decent times thinking that was super busy. I really recommend it for the happy hour.

It had been years since we have been here.. came for the brunch today as my sister is obsessed with their Coffee Cake. This is a review for weekend brunch menu. Our server Norm was efficient, funny, and fun to have around. We started with the Joe s Coffee Cake - today it was Double Chocolate served with Honey on Butter on the side.. split for 4 people is perfect starter to a great brunch.. yes we are a dessert first family.. please don t judge us My sister have the Signature Eggs Benny - scrumptious and eggs done to perfection and the hollandaise sauce was perfect. My brother in law had the Fish and Chips and the fish was tender while the outside is crunchy but not over fried. We couldn t decide as everything on the menu all looked so good. We ordered steak tartare, steamed mussels, and the Lobster Roll. All the food came at once and they kindly split the lobster roll for us.. even half it was huge, and it was full of fresh prawn and lobster with a lovely side salad. We really enjoyed the broth of the mussels and the wonderful toasted homemade bread on top. The steak tartare is excellent and serving was fresh and quite big with 4 pieces of garlic home made toast and side salad. While we are enjoying lunch, there is a lovely piano player, John situated on the turn of the staircase on your way to the upstairs washroom. Not sure if there is any washroom for seniors or handicapped downstairs. In the summer, the restaurant also open the patio upstairs. Another item we wanted to try was Chicken and Waffles, the table beside us ordered it and it was quite a large portion, so maybe next time.

A place with character and much more importantly with a SOUL. Kudos to our Server right at the bar, we forgot to ask her name but she did well today despite being swamped. She s graceful and her smile was outright genuine. The dip lobster oil blended with balsamic is a phenomenal pair to the bread. Definitely added to my   AHA   moments.

Best Happy Hour in the city! If you like seafood don t deprive yourself of Joe Fortes! $1.50 oysters?!? Look at the size of them! You had me at hello   $1 per ounce of wine, max 9oz! Then there s the lobster shrimp rolls. Just look at them - Need I say more?!  The bread was garlic bread by the way! Service - on point! Food - on point! Atmosphere- on point! Sitting at the bar allowed for chit chat with the friendly bar staff as they worked hard at getting the drinks out all while smiling! Really nice afternoon spent enjoying some unreal eats at unreal prices. Note: Very busy at 3pm on Sunday. I was lucky to get a table. Resos are recommended.
The exceptional service and friendly staff left a lasting impression on us. The food was outstanding, and we had a wonderful dining experience.

I hadnt visited here in quite some time. Our dinner experience was fantastic from start to finish. The service was excellent and every person from the doorman checking vaccine passports, to the host, the manager, and server were super nice and helpful. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was vibrant, but not too loud. We were celebrating a birthday and didnt know they provided a complimentary dessert, so that was a pleasant surprise as well. Looking forward to our next visit here!

While visiting Vancouver for the first time from Florida, my wife and I had dinner here last night. Phenomenal. We had the sable lfish and pork chop, two outstanding meals. Our server, Kevin, was very attentive and knowledgeable. This restaurant compares to any high-end restaurant in the US. I would definitely eat here again and I highly recommend it.

Atmosphere of the restaurant was top notch. Loved the old timey feel of the place. Servers were knowledgeable and attentive with great recommendations. Muscles, oysters, dessert, sides were amazing with fresh bread with 2 oil and vinegars for dipping that tasted amazing. Medium rare steak was not consistent throughout with more than I would have liked being rare. Almost a near perfect experience and score. Restaurant is very large and can see it could be difficult to get every steak perfect because of that.

Nice foods and kind staffs. I was there in happy hour time around 4 pm. At that time, it was so busy. We ordered few things. Fried calamari, lobster roll, taco and 12 oysters. All plates are sooo nice and tasty. And also staff is so friendly and very witty. He made me lots of happiness. I would like to go there one more.

If you are looking for a 60s style restaurant with breathtaking architecture, I highly recommend this place.  It is one of my favourite restaurants in the city.  The happy hour options are excellent and available to everyone, but the prices of dishes during the rest of the day are a bit high.  The place reminded me of the Mad Men show, which tells the stories of PR men in New York.  The food is good, and the service is perfect.  If you come to visit Vancouver, this place is worth stopping by. Highly recommend

I recently had the misfortune of dining at this seafood restaurant, and I must say it was a dreadful experience from start to finish. Firstly, the service was abysmal. We were left waiting for what felt like an eternity just to be seated, even though the restaurant wasnt particularly busy. Once we were finally seated, it took ages for a server to come to our table. When they did arrive, they seemed disinterested and inattentive throughout the entire meal. The food was even more disappointing. I ordered the seafood platter, expecting a delicious assortment of fresh seafood. What I got was a plate of overcooked, rubbery, and tasteless seafood that was clearly not fresh. It was as if they had pulled it out of the freezer and microwaved it. To add insult to injury, the prices were exorbitant for the low-quality food and service we received. It felt like a complete rip-off, and I left feeling like I had wasted my hard-earned money on a subpar dining experience. I cannot recommend this restaurant to anyone. Save your time and money and go somewhere else where you can actually enjoy a decent seafood meal and receive proper service. This place is a complete disappointment, and I wont be returning.

Had an amazing anniversary dinner. Staci, our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave good recommendations.  Dinner came promptly and fresh, hot, delicious. The manager Brian, stopped by to check on our meal progress. Overall a wonderful evening!

Food is top notch, staff are lovely, upstairs patio is gorgeous and fun. The inner restaurant is beautiful and bar is beautiful too. The top notch is for quality and price. Its pricey so I stick to the happy hours where theres dollar an ounce wines but I would ask a big spender to take me there in the future :) This restaurant is up there with Black + Blue and Dockside for impressing people and impressing yourself. The upstairs bar/patio/garden was, however, much more lively than the other two. The other two are more quiet.

Yes it s touristy, yes it s old school, but it s damn good and solid and everything feels like a time warp and history.  We got the prawn cocktail, fried oysters, clam chowder, and cioppino and everything was really good.  Service was superb.  Totally forgot to take pictures after the bread basket that came with lobster oil and vinegar, YES.
Celebrated our anniversary at Joe s today and we had the best time! Ordered the Bone-In Rib Steak, Jumbo Prawns, and Truffle Fries and all were amazing. Service is impeccable as well!

Ate here in June 2022. Quite a wonderful experience to eat in a well established classic restaurant. Fine dining setting. Crowded. But still a nice atmosphere. Table was a little small but we managed.

The legacy at Joe Fortes is a long, storied, star-studded one, and for very good reason: the food and service are both consistent regardless of when you visit. Over the years, Ive brought out-of-town guests here and dined here for corporate events. This night, I went with my bridesmaids and soon-to-be husband to celebrate. Of all of them, none had eaten here before. Me, Ive eaten nearly everything on the menu. Racquels service was impeccable warm, professional, and very efficient. Like every server and manager Ive interacted with here, she exhibited all the tenets of hosting, the true spirit of hospitality. Thanks, Joe Fortes. Youve always held up!
First time here, we were celebrating a ridiculous purchase and wanted to lunch.  Our waitress (Ally?) was absolute perfection, the ambience was amazing, and the food was epic. This was a good day .

Went there for our anniversary and the staff was super friendly and accommodating. Calamari was excellent, and the fish dishes were great. They gave us a complimentary creme brule for the occasion! The atmosphere is whatever you want it to be: casual or formal. It did get a bit warm in the restaurant on what was a particularly hot day in Van.

They have the best oysters in the city. We tried three different oysters and our favorite is Royal Miyagi. The service was great. The lady who served us was very friendly and attentive as well as the other servers even though it was crowded and busy at the restaurant. We will definitely come back again.
